alert.note: Alert for Baker; Colquitt; Dougherty; Mitchell; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 12 at 7:38PM EST until January 12 at 8:15PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Dougherty County in southwestern Georgia... Northeastern Mitchell County in southwestern Georgia... Northeastern Baker County in southwestern Georgia... Northwestern Colquitt County in south central Georgia... Southwestern Worth County in south central Georgia... * Until 815 PM EST. * At 738 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Newton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Baconton around 750 PM EST. Putney around 800 PM EST. Marine Corps Logistics Base around 810 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Bridgeboro, Flint, Red Store Crossroads, Livingston, Ticknor, Minnesota, Pecan City, Acree, Lester and Pritchetts. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
